tit.j: 日墺修好通商航海条約
tit.e: Japanese Austrian Amiable treaty of commerce and navigation
Treaty of Amity and Commerce between Japan and Austria
tit.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
tit.e: Treaty of Amity and Commerce between Japan and Austria

sen.j: 日墺修好通商航海条約（にちおうしゅうこうつうしょうこうかいじょうやく）とは、日本とオーストリア＝ハンガリー帝国との間で1869年10月18日（明治2年9月14日 (旧暦)）に締結された条約。
sen.e: Japanese Austrian amity treaty of commerce and navigation is an agreement concluded between Japan and Austria, Hungarian empire in October 18, 1869(September 14, 1869 in old calendar).
The Japan-Austria Treaty of Amity and Commerce was an agreement concluded between Japan and Austria/Hungarian empire on October 18, 1869.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The Japan-Austria Treaty of Amity and Commerce was an agreement concluded between Japan and Austria/Hungarian empire on October 18, 1869.

sen.j: これによって両国の国交が開かれた。
sen.e: The diplomatic relations of the countries were established by the agreement.
National relations were established through this treaty.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: National relations were established through this treaty.

sen.j: だが同時に、欧米列強による日本に対する不平等条約の集大成とも言われている。
sen.e: But, at the same time, it is said to be the accomplishment of an unequal treaty against Japan by the western great powers.
At the same time, it was said to be the achievement of an unfair treaty against Japan by western powers.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: At the same time, it was said to be the achievement of an unfair treaty against Japan by western powers.

sen.j: なお、ハンガリーの略表記である「洪（きょう）」を加えて「日墺洪（にちおうきょう）～」と表記する場合もある。
sen.e: There are some cases where it is written as "Nichiokyo"by adding "kyo" which is the abbreviation of Hungary.
The abbreviation "kyo", which stands for Hungary, is sometimes added to the title of the treaty and is read, "Nichioukyo" (Japan/Austria/Hungary).
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The abbreviation 'kyo,' which stands for Hungary, is sometimes added to the title of the treaty and is read, 'Nichioukyo' (Japan/Austria/Hungary).

sen.j: アジア諸国との外交関係樹立のため、日本を訪れたオーストリアのアントン・ペッツ（Anton von Petz）と日本の外務卿澤宣嘉の間で締結され、1872年1月12日（明治4年12月3日 (旧暦)）に批准書の交換が行われた。
sen.e: It was concluded by and between a Japanese Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry), Nobuyoshi SAWA and Anton von Petz from Austria who visited Japan to establish diplomatic relations between various districts of Asia and exchanged instruments of ratification in January 12, 1872 (December 3, 1871 in the old calendar).

It was concluded by and between Japan's Foreign Minister, Nobuyoshi SAWA, and Austria's Anton von Petz who visited Japan while on a mission to establish diplomatic relations between various districts of Asia and they exchanged instruments of ratification on January 12, 1872.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: It was concluded by and between Japan's Foreign Minister, Nobuyoshi SAWA, and Austria's Anton von Petz who visited Japan while on a mission to establish diplomatic relations between various districts of Asia and they exchanged instruments of ratification on January 12, 1872.

sen.j: この条約の締結にはイギリス公使ハリー・パークスの仲介があったが、この条約には安政条約以来欧米各国が江戸幕府及び明治政府と締結した全ての不平等条約の規定の中でもっとも有利な条件が反映され、その内容は各国が日本と結んだ条約の最恵国待遇の規定によって全ての列強に対して適用されることとなった。
sen.e: English Minister, Harry Parks mediated for the conclusion of this treaty and the most favorable conditions among all the regulations of the unequal treaties concluded between Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and the Meiji Government and Europe and the North America since Ansei era treaty were applied to this and the content was applied to all the great powers by the regulation of the most favored nation status treatment of the treaties that each country concluded between Japan.

English Minister, Harry Parks mediated for the conclusion of this treaty, and among all the unfair treaties concluded between the Edo government and the Meiji government with Europe and the North America since the Ansei era treaty, the treaty contained the most advantageous conditions, the contents of which applied to all countries who had made "Most Favored Nation Treatment" treaties with Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: English Minister, Harry Parks mediated for the conclusion of this treaty, and among all the unfair treaties concluded between the Edo government and the Meiji government with Europe and the North America since the Ansei era treaty, the treaty contained the most advantageous conditions, the contents of which applied to all countries who had made "Most Favored Nation Treatment" treaties with Japan.

sen.j: 特に領事裁判権の分野では日本側に最も不利な規定となり、結果的にはそれが他の欧米列強にも自動的に適用されることとなった。
sen.e: Especially in the field of consular jurisdiction, it turned up to be the most unfavorable regulation for Japan and consequently it was applied to other western great powers.
Especially in the field of consular jurisdiction, it turned out to contain the most unfavorable regulations for Japan and was consequently applied to other western great powers as well
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Especially in the field of consular jurisdiction, it turned out to contain the most unfavorable regulations for Japan and was consequently applied to other western great powers as well

sen.j: これによって、欧米による日本に対する不平等条約の強制が完了したと言える。
sen.e: We can say that the western enforcement of the unequal treaty was completed by this.
With this the West's enforcement of unfair treaties on Japan was completed.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: With this the West's enforcement of unfair treaties on Japan was completed.

sen.j: なお、この条約では、従来は開港場を神奈川宿とするとしていた規定が、初めて実際の開港場である横浜港に変更された。
sen.e: The regulation that used to designate Kanagawa-juku as an open port was modified for the first time to Yokohama bay which was the real open port.
The regulation that used to designate Kanagawa-juku as an open port was modified for the first time to Yokohama bay, which was the actual open port.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The regulation that used to designate Kanagawa-juku as an open port was modified for the first time to Yokohama bay, which was the actual open port.
